message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it discusses the pursuit of explaining and improving generalization in deep learning, which is a core topic in machine learning. Additionally, the paper uses visualization techniques to understand the loss surface geometry, which is a common approach in machine learning research. 

The paper also discusses the use of adversarial training data augmentation, which is a technique commonly used in computer vision (cs.CV) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) to improve the robustness of deep learning models. 

Furthermore, the paper discusses the relationship between generalization and loss landscapes geometries, which is a topic relevant to the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as adversarial attacks are a common security concern in deep learning. 

Finally, the paper uses filter normalization, which is a technique commonly used in neural networks (cs.NE), to visualize the loss surface geometry.
